description: From Latin dissipābilis, from dissipāre, also written dissupare (“to scatter, disperse, demolish, destroy, squander, dissipate”), from dis- (“apart”) + supare (“to throw”).

adjectives.description: dissipable (comparative more dissipable, superlative most dissipable)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Capable of being dissipated or dispersed.
examples: A substance dissipable and apt to be dispersed.
